bug.short_desc: Use CSS style to style the placeholder color for FF

long_desc.thetext: Firefox 4 uses the same color set for the input element for the placeholder text. As we are setting a color to all input fiels, our placeholders look like regular text entered in the inout fields.

Changed our implementation for firefox 4 to use the fallback solution for the 1.4 / 1.3.1 release.

Still valid for FF12. Now it seems quite sure that its on intension. I renamed the bug to change the implementation to use the CSS style to get the color back to the original color. Still, moving it to the next release because the current fallback works as designed.

Managed to use the CSS pseudo selectors to style the colors. That fixed two things:
1. We can use the native placeholder for FF 2. The placeholder color specified in the theme is now applied to both, fake and native placeholders.
